content:
Yes, Stanford University is aware of the financial challenges faced by international graduate students and has implemented some initiatives to address this issue. 

In 2019, the university announced the Stanford Graduate Fellowship (SGF) which is primarily designed to cover tuition and living expenses for international PhD students in the first three years of their graduate program. This fellowship provides a full tuition and stipend package to help reduce the financial burden on international graduate students. 

Moreover, the university's different schools and departments continue to seek out additional funding support from private foundations and philanthropic donors, which can help fund scholarships and fellowships for international students. Additionally, advocacy organizations such as the Presidential Committee for International Students and the Graduate Student Council are continuously working with the university's administration to find creative and sustainable ways to address the financial challenges faced by international students.  

It is important to note that while there are limited financial aid options available for international graduate students, the university continues to explore new avenues to help make graduate education more affordable and accessible.
